books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.description: A novel about the serious issues of race and class in the Deep South.

books.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
books.description: A multi-generational story blending magical realism and Colombian history.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.description: A classic romance novel exploring manners, marriage, and morality in 19th-century England.

books.title: Don Quixote
books.description: A satirical novel about a man who becomes a knight-errant in search of adventure.

books.title: Moby Dick
books.description: An epic tale of obsession and revenge between a sea captain and a white whale.

books.title: The Odyssey
books.description: An ancient Greek epic poem about Odysseus's journey home after the Trojan War.

authors.name: George Orwell
authors.bio: George Orwell was an English novelist, essayist, journalist and critic, best known for his novels '1984' and 'Animal Farm'.

authors.name: Harper Lee
authors.bio: Harper Lee was an American novelist widely known for 'To Kill a Mockingbird', published in 1960.

authors.name: Gabriel García Márquez
authors.bio: Gabriel García Márquez was a Colombian novelist, short-story writer, screenwriter and journalist, known for popularizing magical realism.

authors.name: Jane Austen
authors.bio: Jane Austen was an English novelist known primarily for her six major novels, including 'Pride and Prejudice'.

authors.name: Miguel de Cervantes
authors.bio: Miguel de Cervantes was a Spanish writer widely regarded as the greatest writer in the Spanish language, best known for 'Don Quixote'.

authors.name: Herman Melville
authors.bio: Herman Melville was an American novelist, short story writer, and poet of the American Renaissance period, best known for 'Moby Dick'.

authors.name: Homer
authors.bio: Homer is the legendary ancient Greek author of the epic poems the Iliad and the Odyssey.

authors.name: Dante Alighieri
authors.bio: Dante Alighieri was an Italian poet, writer and philosopher, best known for his epic poem 'The Divine Comedy'.

categories.name: American Classic
categories.description: Classic literature written by American authors, often reflecting American culture and history.

categories.name: Dystopian
categories.description: A genre of speculative fiction depicting an imagined society characterized by suffering, oppression, or extreme injustice.

categories.name: Magical Realism
categories.description: A literary genre in which magical elements are blended into a realistic atmosphere.

categories.name: Russian Classic
categories.description: Classic works of literature from Russian authors, often exploring philosophical and social themes.

categories.name: Romance
categories.description: A genre centered on romantic love and its complications.

categories.name: Spanish Classic
categories.description: Classic literature written by Spanish authors, often reflecting Spanish culture and history.

categories.name: Adventure
categories.description: A genre featuring stories of adventure, exploration, and risk.

categories.name: Epic Poetry
categories.description: A lengthy narrative poem, often detailing heroic deeds and events significant to a culture or nation.
